content.description: There is a hard thin move low--Tahoe 11A.  After the cracks there is a tricky 11A balance area.  The route is almost completely bolted but I used a few small cams.
content.protection: Bolts and cams to 1.5 inches.  I counted 13 bolts.
content.location: Bolt line about 25 ft right of Directissimo

content.description: I remember 8 bolts.  Bolts are closely spaced at cruxes.  Excellent balance moves on marginal knobs. The way through the first 5 or 6 bolts is continuously challenging.  I'd call this a Tahoe 10D.  Eases up for the last 30 or 40 ft.  Shares start and final anchor with Directissimo.
content.protection: Bolts.  Knob sling up high.I backed up the bottom anchor with #1,2 Camalot for a rope solo
content.location: The furthest route left on the south face.    The first bolt is right of the crack/flake.  Go a little high then cross right for the route.

content.description: Excellent mixed route past two cracks to knobby face.
content.protection: Bolts plus gear to three inch.  Singles
content.location: Head straight up the 5.8 face 3-5 feet right of the crack, aiming toward the bolt at 15 ft. Go past the bolt to crack then layback/stem high enough to plug a 3 inch cam into the high crack overhead.  Climb the face above the crack past about 4 bolts to the anchor.
